{{Multiple issues | orphan=October 2011 |peacock=June 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2011}} '''Tony Woodhams''' (born 7 August 1969) is an industry recognized and accomplished Investment Banking Consultant Director and Risk adviser to clients including HSBC and Credit Suisse. A former professional independent derivatives trader of 15 years, Woodhams now specializes in Risk, algorithmic risk systems and "big data" link analysis designed to support the identification of Rogue / Inappropriate Trading and advanced Trade Surveillance. Woodhams teams run ground breaking risk projects within a number of leading Global Investment Banks. Specialist in Rogue Trading Risk and advanced Trade Surveillance, and adviser in regulatory interpretation and response, program synergies and technology alignment across organizations with a Business & Front Office focus.
A strong leader and communicator able to proficiently manage senior business and technology teams alike. An in-depth working knowledge & understanding of trading cultures and behaviors. Woodhams works closely with senior management within leading investments banks, advising on best practices to meet new risk challenges and regulatory mandates. Studied in psychology and behavioral sciences.
Woodhams began his career in the 80's in the [[city of London]], where he built a successful [[derivatives trading]] business on the [[London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange]] (L.I.F.F.E.). Specializing in [[algorithmic trading]], [[genetic algorithm]]s, [[automated trading system]]s, and financial trading technology and risk.
Woodhams and friends climbed [[Kilimanjaro]] in 2011 and cycled 1000 miles to Monaco in 2012 in aid of Breast Cancer UK.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/2c389f30-25ab-11e0-8258-00144feab49a,s01=1.html#axzz1OjfolBju |title=/ Companies – Mountain high |work=Financial Times |date=22 January 2011 |accessdate=12 November 2011}}</ref>
Woodhams has two children, Stacey and Holly, and currently lives in Essex, UK. Holly is a British under 14 [[street dance]] champion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.echo-news.co.uk/news/local_news/4580219.Talented_Holly_does_the_double_in_dance_contest/?ref=rss |title=Talented Holly does the double in dance contest (From Echo) |publisher=Echo-news.co.uk |date=4 September 2009 |accessdate=12 November 2011}}</ref> Holly dances for England, "Goodman Dance" owned by [[Len Goodman]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goodmandance.co.uk/street.php |title=The Len Goodman Dance Centre – Street/Hip Hop Dance |publisher=Goodmandance.co.uk |accessdate=12 November 2011}}</ref> and "Zoo Nation" in [[Islington]] run by Kate Prince.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zoonation.co.uk/ |title=ZooNation |publisher=ZooNation |accessdate=12 November 2011}}</ref>
